From phulasso; a guarding or, the act, the person; figuratively, the place, the condition, or, the time, literally or figuratively.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
20.str2: To disobey, rebel, be disloyal, refuse conformity. From apeithes; to disbelieve.
At one time or other, at some time, formerly. From the base of pou and te; indefinite adverb, at some time, ever.
When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

20.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
20.str2: To expect eagerly, wait for eagerly, look for. From apo and ekdechomai; to expect fully.
Patience, forbearance, longsuffering. From the same as makrothumos; longanimity, i.e. forbearance or fortitude.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
(Hebrew) Noah. Of Hebrew origin; Noe, a patriarch.
A box, i.e. The sacred ark and that of Noah.

20.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Feminine Singular
20.str2: From kata and a derivative of skeuos; to prepare thoroughly; by implication, to construct, create.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

20.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Singular
20.str2: Who, which, what, that.
Puny; especially neuter somewhat.
This; he, she, it.
Eight. A primary numeral; 'eight'.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
20.str2: From dia and sozo; to save thoroughly, i.e. to cure, preserve, rescue, etc.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Water. And genitive case, hudatos, etc. From the base of huetos; water literally or figuratively.

21.str2: And, even, also, namely.

21.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
21.str2: Who, which, what, that.
Neuter of a compound of anti and tupos; corresponding, i.e. A representative, counterpart.
The rite or ceremony of baptism. From baptizo; baptism.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.

21.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
21.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
A putting off, a laying down. From apotithemi; a laying aside.
Filth, filthiness, dirt, squalor. Of uncertain affinity; dirt, i.e. depravity.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
Inquiry, request, appeal, demand; a profession, pledge. From eperotao; an inquiry.
A primary word; 'good'.
The conscience, a persisting notion. From a prolonged form of suneido; co-perception, i.e. Moral consciousness.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
A rising again, resurrection. From anistemi; a standing up again, i.e. a resurrection from death (its author), or a recovery.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

22.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular

22.str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

22.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
22.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
On the right hand, right hand, right. From dechomai; the right side or hand.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
From exesti; privilege, i.e. force, capacity, competency, freedom, or mastery, delegated influence.
From dunamai; force; specially, miraculous power.

22.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
22.str2: From hupo and tasso; to subordinate; reflexively, to obey.

22.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
22.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
